newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq stocks close up, end 2-day slide.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq stocks close up, end 2-day slide.

text.p: Nasdaq stocks closed higher on Thursday, halting two straight declining sessions.
The Nasdaq Composite rose 0.60 percent to 1330.80, with winners and losers ending nearly even on volume of nearly 632 million shares. The broader Russell 2000 index slipped 0.12 to 360.10.
"Although the Big Board acted much better than our market, the Nasdaq didn't have as much to make up (after Wednesday)," said Patrick Davis, head of OTC trading at Salomon Brothers.
The Dow Industrials rose nearly 51 points to 7137 on Thursday after falling nearly 140 points on Tuesday.
GCR Holdings Ltd rose 4-7/8 to 27-1/4 on news that Exel Ltd was buying the rest of GCR for $27 per share cash.
Intel muscled up 2-7/8 to 158-3/4. Merrill Lynch was bullish on the stock in a Wednesday conference call to clients.
Gymboree dropped 2-12/16 to 24-13/16. The retailer reported that April same-store sales fell seven percent.
